title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: vignette explains manage cassidyrâ€™s project memory across sessions using different memory locations best practices. cassidyr package can remember preferences, project context, coding guidelines across chat sessions. launch cassidy_app(), automatically loads project memory files provide relevant context AI assistant.

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: cassidyr offers multiple memory locations hierarchical structure, serving different purpose: memory files automatically loaded launch cassidy_app(). Files loaded order user-level project-level, project-specific settings taking precedence. Note: CASSIDY.local.md files automatically added .gitignore, making ideal private project-specific preferences checked version control.

what: How cassidyr Looks Up Memory Files
title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: default, cassidyr searches memory files two locations: personal preferences apply R projects Loaded first (lowest priority) ./CASSIDY.md ./.cassidy/CASSIDY.md ./CASSIDY.local.md (gitignored, personal project notes) ./.cassidy/rules/*.md (modular rules) Loaded second (highest priority, overrides user-level) design keeps memory files discoverable predictable - anyone clones R package see exactly context used.

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: easiest way create project memory file use_cassidy_md() function:
code: library(cassidyr)  # Create CASSIDY.md in project root use_cassidy_md()  # Create in .cassidy/ directory (keeps root clean) use_cassidy_md(location = "hidden")  # Create local-only file (not shared with team) use_cassidy_md(location = "local")

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: cassidyr provides several templates get started:
code: # Default template - general purpose use_cassidy_md(template = "default")  # Package development template use_cassidy_md(template = "package")  # Data analysis template use_cassidy_md(template = "analysis")  # Survey research template use_cassidy_md(template = "survey")

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: can also manually create CASSIDY.md file. basic example:
code: # Project Context for Cassidy AI  ## Project Overview This is an R package for analyzing survey data with a focus on factor analysis and scale reliability.  ## Key Files - `R/factor_analysis.R` - Main EFA/CFA functions - `R/reliability.R` - Cronbach's alpha and omega calculations - `data/survey_data.rda` - Example dataset  ## Coding Preferences - Style: tidyverse with native pipe `|>` - Prefer `dplyr` over base R for data manipulation - Use `ggplot2` for all visualizations - Maximum line length: 80 characters - Always include roxygen2 documentation  ## Common Tasks - Running factor analyses and interpreting results - Creating publication-quality tables - Writing methods sections in APA format - Generating codebooks  ## Packages to Use - `psych` for factor analysis - `lavaan` for CFA - `gt` for tables - `ggplot2` for visualization

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
code: # R Coding Style Guidelines  ## Function Naming - Use `snake_case` for all function names - Prefix exported functions with package name (e.g., `mypackage_analyze()`) - Use `.` prefix for internal helpers  ## Documentation - All exported functions must have complete roxygen2 documentation - Include `@examples` with realistic use cases - Use markdown formatting (`@md` in DESCRIPTION)  ## Testing - Use `testthat 3e` for all tests - Test names should follow: `test_that("function does X when Y")` - Aim for >80% code coverage

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: Create personal preferences apply projects ~/.cassidy/CASSIDY.md:
code: # Create user-level memory directory dir.create("~/.cassidy", showWarnings = FALSE)  # Create your personal CASSIDY.md cat("# My Personal R Preferences  ## Code Style - I prefer tidyverse style with native pipe |> - Use explicit returns in functions - Comment complex logic  ## Favorite Packages - Data manipulation: dplyr, tidyr - Visualization: ggplot2, patchwork - Tables: gt, kableExtra - Modeling: tidymodels, mgcv  ## Common Patterns - Always load tidyverse first - Use here::here() for file paths - Save intermediate results in data/processed/ ",     file = "~/.cassidy/CASSIDY.md" )

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: start cassidy_app(), memory files automatically loaded: app : Search load CASSIDY.md files directory tree. Load files .cassidy/rules/ directories. Combine project context (Git status, file structure, etc.). Send everything AI assistant.
code: library(cassidyr)  # Start app - automatically loads all CASSIDY.md files cassidy_app()  # Start with new context (re-gathers project context) cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE)  # Start with comprehensive context cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE, context_level = "comprehensive")

title: Connect to CassidyAI API
text: scripting automation:
code: library(cassidyr)  # Simple one-off chat result <- cassidy_chat("How do I create a bar plot in ggplot2?") print(result$response)  # Continue the conversation result <- cassidy_chat(   "Can you show me an example with the mtcars dataset?",   thread_id = result$thread_id )  # Or use session-based chat for interactive use session <- cassidy_session() chat(session, "What is the tidyverse?") chat(session, "Which package should I use for data cleaning?")

code: # Create a thread thread_id <- cassidy_create_thread()  # Send messages response <- cassidy_send_message(thread_id, "What is the tidyverse?") print(response)  # Retrieve conversation history thread <- cassidy_get_thread(thread_id)  # List all threads threads <- cassidy_list_threads()

what: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
text: Opens interactive Shiny-based chat interface conversing Cassidy AI assistants. app automatically gathers project context supports conversation persistence.

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
code: cassidy_app(   assistant_id = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID"),   api_key = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_API_KEY"),   new_chat = FALSE,   context_level = c("standard", "minimal", "comprehensive"),   include_data = TRUE,   include_files = NULL,   timeout = 300,   theme = NULL )

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
text: assistant_id Character. Cassidy assistant ID use. Defaults CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID environment variable. api_key Character. Cassidy API key. Defaults CASSIDY_API_KEY environment variable. new_chat Logical. TRUE, starts fresh conversation new context. FALSE (default), resumes recent conversation. context_level Character. Level context include starting new chat: "minimal", "standard", "comprehensive". Default "standard". Ignored new_chat = FALSE. include_data Logical. Whether include data frame context global environment starting new chat. Default TRUE. Ignored new_chat = FALSE. include_files Character vector file paths include initial context starting new chat. Ignored new_chat = FALSE. timeout Numeric. API timeout seconds. Default 300. theme bslib theme object. Default uses clean modern theme.

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
text: Launches Shiny app (called side effects).

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
text: app provides: Real-time chat Cassidy AI Automatic project context injection (new chats) Conversation history sidebar navigation Ability switch multiple conversations Mobile-responsive design

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
text: default (new_chat = FALSE), app resumes recent conversation. useful close app run code want continue discussing results. Use new_chat = TRUE want start fresh updated project context. recommended : made significant changes code starting new task topic want include different files context

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application â€” cassidy_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Resume most recent conversation (default)   cassidy_app()    # Start a new conversation with standard context   cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE)    # Start new with comprehensive context   cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE, context_level = "comprehensive")    # Start new with specific files   cassidy_app(     new_chat = TRUE,     include_files = c("R/my-analysis.R", "data/codebook.md")   ) } # }

title: Chat with CassidyAI â€” cassidy_chat
code: cassidy_chat(   message,   assistant_id = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID"),   thread_id = NULL,   context = NULL,   api_key = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_API_KEY"),   timeout = 120 )

title: Chat with CassidyAI â€” cassidy_chat
text: message Character. message send assistant. assistant_id Character. CassidyAI assistant ID. Defaults CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID environment variable. thread_id Character NULL. existing thread ID continue conversation. NULL (default), new thread created. context Optional context object cassidy_context_project(), cassidy_describe_df(), custom context object text element. Context sent thread creation efficiency. api_key Character. CassidyAI API key. Defaults CASSIDY_API_KEY environment variable. timeout Numeric. Request timeout seconds. Default 120.

title: Chat with CassidyAI â€” cassidy_chat
text: cassidy_chat S3 object containing: thread_id thread ID (save continue conversation) response assistant's response (cassidy_response object) message original message

title: Chat with CassidyAI â€” cassidy_chat
text: thread_id provided, new conversation thread created automatically. continue existing conversation, pass thread_id previous call.

title: Chat with CassidyAI â€” cassidy_chat
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Simple one-off question   result <- cassidy_chat("What is the tidyverse?")   print(result)    # With project context   ctx <- cassidy_context_project()   result <- cassidy_chat("Help me understand this project", context = ctx)    # With data frame context   desc <- cassidy_describe_df(mtcars)   result <- cassidy_chat("What analyses would you recommend?", context = desc)    # Continue the conversation (context already set)   result2 <- cassidy_continue(result, "Tell me more") } # }

what: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
title: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
text: Sends R script CassidyAI add detailed comments explaining section code . Useful documenting quickly-written scripts preparing code sharing.

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
code: cassidy_comment_script(   script_path,   output_path = "auto",   style = c("detailed", "sections", "minimal"),   thread_id = NULL )

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
text: script_path Character. Path R script file. output_path Character NULL. save commented script. NULL, overwrites original (confirmation). "auto", creates new file "_commented" suffix. style Character. Comment style: "detailed" (line--line), "sections" (chunk-level), "minimal" (key operations ). thread_id Character NULL. Existing thread continue.

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
text: cassidy_chat object commented script.

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script â€” cassidy_comment_script
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Add comments and save to new file   cassidy_comment_script("analysis/quick_efa.R", output_path = "auto")    # Section-level comments only   cassidy_comment_script("scripts/cleaning.R", style = "sections")    # Preview without saving   result <- cassidy_comment_script("my_script.R", output_path = NULL)   cat(chat_text(result)) } # }

title: Read File Contents as Context â€” cassidy_describe_file
text: path Path file read. Can absolute relative working directory. max_lines Maximum number lines read. Use Inf read entire file. Defaults Inf (read ). lines Numeric vector specifying specific line numbers read. provided, lines included. Use NULL (default) read lines (subject max_lines). line_range Numeric vector length 2 specifying start end lines (e.g., c(10, 50) reads lines 10-50). Ignored lines provided. show_line_numbers Logical; TRUE, prepends line numbers line. Useful discussing specific line numbers. Defaults TRUE. level Character; detail level file content. One : "full": Complete file contents (default) "summary": Function signatures + key excerpts "index": Metadata function listing Used chat system manage context size. users use default.

title: Read File Contents as Context â€” cassidy_describe_file
text: cassidy_context object containing formatted file contents.

title: Read File Contents as Context â€” cassidy_describe_file
text: function automatically detects file type extension applies appropriate syntax highlighting markdown output. can read files three ways: Entire file: Just provide path Specific lines: Use lines = c(1, 5, 10:20) Line range: Use line_range = c(10, 50) level parameter controls detail: "full": Best detailed code review, includes content "summary": Good understanding structure without full content "index": Minimal metadata, useful many files

title: Read File Contents as Context â€” cassidy_describe_file

what: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
text: Creates project-specific configuration file provides automatic context start cassidy_app(). Follows similar conventions Claude Code's CLAUDE.md files, uses CASSIDY.md naming.

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
code: use_cassidy_md(   path = ".",   location = c("root", "hidden", "local"),   template = c("default", "package", "analysis", "survey"),   open = interactive() )

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
text: path Directory create file (default: current directory) location create file: "root" (CASSIDY.md), "hidden" (.cassidy/CASSIDY.md), "local" (CASSIDY.local.md .gitignore) template Template use: "default", "package", "analysis", "survey" open Whether open file editing (default: TRUE interactive sessions)

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
text: Invisibly returns TRUE file created, FALSE cancelled

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
text: can create project memory files several locations: CASSIDY.md - Project-level, checked git (location = "root") .cassidy/CASSIDY.md - Project-level hidden directory (location = "hidden") CASSIDY.local.md - Local-, auto-gitignored (location = "local") files automatically loaded start cassidy_app(). can also create modular rules .cassidy/rules/*.md files.

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file â€” use_cassidy_md
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create CASSIDY.md in project root use_cassidy_md()  # Create in .cassidy/ directory (keeps root clean) use_cassidy_md(location = "hidden")  # Create local-only file (not shared with team) use_cassidy_md(location = "local")  # Create a package development template use_cassidy_md(template = "package") } # }
